abstract: New York’s WNET will take over the television operations of the New Jersey Network for five years, if a plan presented on Monday by Gov. Chris Christie is ratified by the state legislature.
snippet: New York’s WNET will take over the television operations of the New Jersey Network for five years, if a plan presented on Monday by Gov. Chris Christie is ratified by the state legislature.
lead_paragraph: 4:57 p.m. | Updated New York’s WNET will take over the television operations of the New Jersey Network for five years under a deal announced on Monday by Gov. Chris Christie.

headline.main: WNET to Oversee New Jersey Public Television
